result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Anthony M Kralewski
Current: No address known,   (Effective: 07-18-2017)
Prior: 718 E. Maryland St. #7, St. Croix Falls, WI 54024
Bond applied to fines owing in 15CF57.

15cf339 Defendant Anthony M Kralewski in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. KM-clerk 9:11 a.m.  State-amended information now filed in 15CF57.   Anthony Krawlewski S&T, 9:12 a.m.  15CF57-amended information, def pleas guilty to ct 1 in 15CF57.  CT-goes over plea questionnaire, finds plea is entered FVI&K, def previously waived right to PSI, accept plea, find guilty to ct 1 in 15CF57 and enter JOC into the record, read-in ct 1 in 15CF339 and dismiss.  State/Atty-gives recommendation.  Def-speaks.

CT-SENTENCE:  w/hold sentence, probation 2 years, appear at probation today, bank 180 days jail, AODA and compliance, get GED/HSED while on probation, no sentence credit, $290.60 plus $250 DNA Surcharge, $25/month payment plan starting July 1, apply bond, convicted felon, cannot vote or posses firearms, Atty to go over post conviction rights, read-in and dismiss ct 1 in 15CF339.  Adjourn 9:31 a.m.
Plea of Not Guilty and Defense Motions

CASES: 15CF339, 15CF57 Defendant Anthony M Kralewski in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Defendant Anthony M Kralewski in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   KJB- Clerk. 1101am Not resolved. 15CF57 needs analyst. JAt to schedule JT w/analyst & counsel. 15CF339 to track. bonds cont. 11:02am adj.

10% CASH COMPONENT MUST BE PAID PRIOR TO BE RELEASED FROM JAIL.  Must have clean UA before release from jail.  Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety  Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.

Defendant Anthony M Kralewski in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis via telephone WLC.   Defendant Anthony M Kralewski in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 1:57 pm  Atty Davis - motion to modify bond.  Def took UA & results were clean.  Atty Davis req bond modified to $2500 SIBS.  State - Obj.  CT - modifies bond to $2500 SIBS  10% CASH COMPONENT.   All non-monetary conditions remain in effect.  Added condition:  Absolute Sobriety.  CT - creates new bond.  2:01 pm adj.
Info filed. Def plea of NG. bond cont. CT sets FPT in CASES: 15CF339, 15CF57. Jail to give Def UA. 10:40am adj

Defendant Anthony M Kralewski in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Defendant Anthony M Kralewski in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 10:31am Def wishes to waive PH. CT accepts waiver, Def bound over.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Must have clean UA before release from jail.  Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.

Defendant Anthony M Kralewski in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 4:05 pm  15CF57 is open case w/Atty Davis.  CT sets bond.  Def to be turned over to the PCJ today.  Bond cont. 4:08 pm adj.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 11:00 am.
